org.fujion.plotly.layout

Class XYZAxisOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.ancillary.Options
      • org.fujion.plotly.layout.AxisOptions
        • org.fujion.plotly.layout.XYZAxisOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOptionMapTransform, IClientTransform

    public class XYZAxisOptions
extends AxisOptions
    Layout options for x, y, and z axes.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  XYZAxisOptions.ConstrainEnum
      If this axis needs to be compressed (either due to its own scaleanchor and scaleratio or those of the other axis), this setting determines how that happens.

      The layer on which this axis is displayed.
      static class  XYZAxisOptions.MirrorEnum
      Determines if the axis lines or/and ticks are mirrored to the opposite side of the plotting area.
      static class  XYZAxisOptions.SideEnum
      Determines where an axis is positioned in the plotting area.
      static class  XYZAxisOptions.SpikeSnapEnum
      Determines the spike snap behavior.

    • Field Detail

      • anchor

        @Option
public String anchor
        If set to an opposite-letter axis id (e.g. "x2", "y"), this axis is bound to the corresponding opposite-letter axis. If set to "free", this axis' position is determined by "position".

      • constrain

        @Option
public XYZAxisOptions.ConstrainEnum constrain
        Determines how axis compression occurs.

        Default: RANGE

      • constraintoward$horizontal

        @Option(value="constraintoward")
public HorizontalAlignEnum constraintoward$horizontal
        When axis compression occurs, determines which direction we push the originally specified plot area.

      • constraintoward$vertical

        @Option(value="constraintoward")
public VerticalAlignEnum constraintoward$vertical
        When axis compression occurs, determines which direction we push the originally specified plot area.

      • domain

        @Option
public Integer[] domain
        The domain of this axis (in plot fraction).

        Default: [0,1]

      • hoverformat

        @Option
public String hoverformat
        The hover text formatting rule using d3 formatting mini-languages which are very similar to those in Python. For numbers, see here, and for dates see here. We add one item to d3's date formatter: "%{n}f" for fractional seconds with n digits. For example, "2016-10-13 09:15:23.456" with tickformat "%H~%M~%S.%2f" would display "09~15~23.46"

      • scaleAnchor

        @Option
public String scaleAnchor
        If set to another axis id (e.g. "x2", "y"), the range of this axis changes together with the range of the corresponding axis such that the scale of pixels per unit is in a constant ratio. Both axes are still zoomable, but when you zoom one, the other will zoom the same amount, keeping a fixed midpoint. "constrain" and "constraintoward" determine how we enforce the constraint. You can chain these, ie "yaxis: {scaleanchor: "x"}, xaxis2: {scaleanchor: "y"}" but you can only link axes of the same "type". The linked axis can have the opposite letter (to constrain the aspect ratio) or the same letter (to match scales across subplots). Loops ("yaxis: {scaleanchor: "x"}, xaxis: {scaleanchor: "y"}" or longer) are redundant and the last constraint encountered will be ignored to avoid possible inconsistent constraints via "scaleratio".

      • layer

        @Option
public XYZAxisOptions.LayerEnum layer
        The layer on which this axis is displayed.

      • mirror

        @Option
public XYZAxisOptions.MirrorEnum mirror
        Determines if the axis lines or/and ticks are mirrored to the opposite side of the plotting area.

      • overlaying

        @Option
public String overlaying
        If set a same-letter axis id, this axis is overlaid on top of the corresponding same-letter axis. If "false", this axis does not overlay any same-letter axes.

      • position

        @Option
public Double position
        The position of this axis in the plotting space (in normalized coordinates). Only has an effect if "anchor" is set to "free".

        Constraints: ≥0 and ≤1

        Default: 0

      • rangeselector

        @Option
public final RangeSelectorOptions rangeselector
        Options for range selectors. (x-axis only).

      • rangeslider

        @Option
public final RangeSliderOptions rangeslider
        Options for range sliders. (x-axis only).

      • scaleanchor

        @Option
public String scaleanchor
        If set to another axis id (e.g. "x2", "y"), the range of this axis changes together with the range of the corresponding axis such that the scale of pixels per unit is in a constant ratio. Both axes are still zoomable, but when you zoom one, the other will zoom the same amount, keeping a fixed midpoint. "constrain" and "constraintoward" determine how we enforce the constraint. You can chain these, ie "yaxis: {scaleanchor: "x"}, xaxis2: {scaleanchor: "y"}" but you can only link axes of the same "type". The linked axis can have the opposite letter (to constrain the aspect ratio) or the same letter (to match scales across subplots). Loops ("yaxis: {scaleanchor: "x"}, xaxis: {scaleanchor: "y"}" or longer) are redundant and the last constraint encountered will be ignored to avoid possible inconsistent constraints via "scaleratio".

      • scaleratio

        @Option
public Double scaleratio
        If this axis is linked to another by "scaleanchor", this determines the pixel to unit scale ratio. For example, if this value is 10, then every unit on this axis spans 10 times the number of pixels as a unit on the linked axis. Use this for example to create an elevation profile where the vertical scale is exaggerated a fixed amount with respect to the horizontal.

        Constraints: ≥0

        Default: 1

      • showspikes

        @Option
public Boolean showspikes
        Determines whether or not spikes (aka droplines) are drawn for this axis. Note: This only takes affect when hovermode = closest.

      • side

        @Option
public XYZAxisOptions.SideEnum side
        Determines whether a x (y) axis is positioned at the "bottom" ("left") or "top" ("right") of the plotting area.

      • spikecolor

        @Option
public String spikecolor
        The spike color. If undefined, will use the series color.

      • spikedash$enum

        @Option(value="spikedash")
public DashStyleEnum spikedash$enum
        The dash style of lines.

      • spikedash$string

        @Option(value="spikedash")
public String spikedash$string
        Alternate form using a dash length list in px (eg "5px,10px,2px,2px").

      • spikemode

        @Option
public String spikemode
        Any combination of "toaxis", "across", "marker" joined with a "+" examples: "toaxis", "across", "toaxis+across", "toaxis+across+marker" default: "toaxis" Determines the drawing mode for the spike line If "toaxis", the line is drawn from the data point to the axis the series is plotted on. If "across", the line is drawn across the entire plot area, and supercedes "toaxis". If "marker", then a marker dot is drawn on the axis the series is plotted on.

      • spikesnap

        @Option
public XYZAxisOptions.SpikeSnapEnum spikesnap
        Determines whether spikelines are stuck to the cursor or to the closest datapoints.

      • spikethickness

        @Option
public Integer spikethickness
        The width (in px) of the zero line.

        Default: 3

      • ticklen

        @Option
public Integer ticklen
        The tick length (in px).

        Default: 5

      • ticks

        @Option
public TicksEnum ticks
        Determines if and where ticks are drawn.

      • visible

        @Option
public Boolean visible
        A single toggle to hide the axis while preserving interaction like dragging. Default is true when a cheater plot is present on the axis, otherwise false.

      • zeroline

        @Option
public Boolean zeroline
        Determines whether or not a line is drawn at along the 0 value of this axis. If true, the zero line is drawn on top of the grid lines.

      • zerolinecolor

        @Option
public String zerolinecolor
        The line color of the zero line.

        Default: "#444"

      • zerolinewidth

        @Option
public Integer zerolinewidth
        The width (in px) of the zero line.

        Default: 1

        public XYZAxisOptions()
